Is it a Link or a Button? 🔗🤔

Lesson 3.10.0

Written by JP de Vries

Improve this Page

Table of Contents

If you don't have a valid href value for your <a>, then you should probably use a <button>

— Ian Devlin (@iandevlin) December 2, 2016

In other words, if you can’t right click and open in a new tab, it’s a <button> https://t.co/P7klqadRJa

— Markup Tips (@mrktps) December 2, 2016

DEV's if you don't have href on <a> tags they won't get keyboard focus. Use a <button> or at least provide an href value. #a11y #WCAG 2.2.1

— David MacDonald (@davidmacd) October 19, 2016
« 📲 Responsive Design Beyond the Viewport 👀 ↔️ Navigational Design Patterns »
